FuncDef:
The lns calling-station-id format agent-remote-id command configures an LNS to parse the Agent-Remote-Id attribute carried in an ICRQ packet sent from an LAC and encapsulate the attribute into the Calling-Station-Id attribute to be sent to the RADIUS server.
The undo lns calling-station-id format agent-remote-id command restores the default configuration.
By default, the Line ID is encapsulated in the AVP22 attribute sent by the LAC.
ExtraInfo: To allow a user to be authenticated based on the line ID information carried in the Agent-Remote-Id attribute of an ICRQ packet sent from an LAC, run the lns calling-station-id format agent-remote-id command to configure an LNS to parse the Agent-Remote-Id attribute and encapsulate the attribute into the Calling-Station-Id attribute to be sent to the RADIUS server.
